summary: Death scythe from the game Darksiders 2
descriptionHtml:
DARKSIDERS 2 DEATH SCYTHE

My first mod for Skyrim.
A simple weapon I made in 3DS Max more for training than modding and it appears good enough to me to give it a try as a mod.
This was done from a few images collected on the net before the game was out, some some people could find some differences with the game model.
This weapon is stand-alone and can be crafted and upgraded in any forge.
This is used as a battle axe but as some people prefer one handed weapons, I also shortened the models to make a war axe.
Put the data folder in the archive in the Skyrim folder and that\'s all.No download manager, sorry.
Don\'t forget to check the Esp in your mod list.

Thanks and I hope you\'ll enjoy it
AthenaX
 P.S. the Death reaper robes you can see on the last image is my next mod and is on the way.

16 november 2012 Update:
Darksiders 2 Death Scythe add-on
New Esp available.
This Esp is an add-on to my mod Darksiders 2 Death Scythe.
you can always forge the normal scythes but it adds 2 new ones with lowered stats for people who don\'t want to play with too powerful weapons.

It modifies the stats of the Scythes weapons( both one-handed and two-handed), so they match the Daedric weapons stats.
The Daedric damage stats are 25 for the battleaxe(2-handed) and 15 for the waraxe( 1-handed), but these stats are specific to your levels and skills in game at the moment you forge them, so they can vary greatly.
Let\'s just say , in my game, for example, the short scythe has 60 in damage and the Death scythe has 120.
In Daedric crafting, at the forge, you got the usual Death scythe and Death short scythe plus the lowered one,Death scythe DS and Death short scythe DS.
You still need the main mod for this to work, so download it and once installed, just replace the Esp \"Darksiders 2 Death Scythe\" in your data folder by the one in the archive.

3 october 2012 Update: 
The textures have been redone in 2048*2048 px. Download the optional file and put the content of the archive in your data folder.
author: AthenaX
